metadata.Title: CVE-2022-4515 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in Exuberant Ctags in the way it handles the "-o" option. This option specifies the tag filename. A crafted tag filename specified in the command line or in the configuration file results in arbitrary command execution because the externalSortTags() in sort.c calls the system(3) function in an unsafe way.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-4515` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exuberant-ctags - 1:5.9~svn20110310-16ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exuberant-ctags package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:5.9~svn20110310-16ubuntu0.22.04.1').
